items.title: Guidance: Nuclear industry: principles to guide the application of As Low As Reasonably Practicable (ALARP) and Best Available Techniques (BAT)
items.summary: A set of principles on effective ways of working to guide the application of ALARP and BAT in the nuclear industry.

items.title: Policy paper: Prime Minister's strategic steer to the nuclear sector
items.summary: Following the Nuclear Regulatory Taskforce review, the Prime Minister issued a strategic steer calling for system-wide reset to accelerate safe and efficient delivery through proportionate regulation and stronger collaboration.

items.title: Policy paper: Reform of non-compete clauses in employment contracts: working paper
items.summary: This working paper seeks views on different options to reform non-compete clauses in employment contracts.

items.title: Gas system in transition: security of supply
items.summary: We are seeking views on our assessment of GB’s long-term supply of gas, and proposed policy actions to protect our gas and energy security during the transition.

items.title: Policy paper: National Licensing Policy Framework for the hospitality and leisure sectors
items.summary: Strategic vision for a modern, permissive licensing system that safeguards communities while enabling hospitality and leisure to thrive.

items.title: Reforming the licensing system
items.summary: Seeking views and evidence to develop a modern, proportionate and enabling licensing system under the Licensing Act 2003.

items.title: Solar on car parks and electric vehicle charging
items.summary: We're seeking views on a proposal to mandate the installation of solar canopies on new outdoor car parks, subject to certain exemptions, as well as views around current planning policy relating to EV charging infrastructure.

items.title: Peter Kyle addresses guests at the SMMT Annual Dinner
items.summary: The Business and Trade Secretary delivers the key note speech at the Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders (SMMT) annual dinner.

items.title: Guidance: Whistleblowing: list of prescribed people and bodies
items.summary: List of prescribed people and bodies you can report malpractice to, other than your employer.

items.title: Low Carbon Contracts Company and Electricity Settlements Company operational costs: 2026/27, 2027/28 and 2028/29
items.summary: We are seeking views on the operational cost levies for the Low Carbon Contracts Company and the Electricity Settlements Company 2026/27, 2027/28 and 2028/29.

items.title: Policy paper: UK Emissions Trading Scheme (UK ETS): policy overview
items.summary: The role of the UK Emissions Trading Scheme in UK decarbonisation and how the UK ETS Authority is developing the scheme.

items.title: UK ETS scope expansion: emissions from international maritime voyages
items.summary: The UK ETS Authority is seeking input on proposals for expanding the UK Emissions Trading Scheme to emissions from international maritime.

items.title: UK ETS scope expansion: maritime sector
items.summary: The UK ETS Authority is seeking input on proposals for expanding the UK Emissions Trading Scheme to the maritime sector.

items.title: Guidance: Participating in the UK Emissions Trading Scheme (UK ETS)
items.summary: This page provides an overview of the UK Emissions Trading Scheme (UK ETS), who it applies to, and the first steps for participants looking to engage with the scheme.

items.title: Guidance: Heat Networks Zoning Pilot
items.summary: The zone identification pilot set out to develop a consistent, standardised methodology to identify areas where heat networks are expected to provide the lowest cost, low carbon heat to buildings.

items.title: Policy paper: Industrial Strategy
items.summary: Strategy document setting out a new economic approach to backing the UK’s strengths, with ambitious plans for 8 high-growth sectors.

items.title: Transparency data: DESNZ: workforce management information, October 2025
items.summary: Reports on departmental staff numbers and costs.

items.title: Notice: Trade remedies notices: anti-dumping duty on ceramic tableware and kitchenware from China
items.summary: Trade remedies notices published by the Secretary of State for Business and Trade relating to the anti-dumping duty on ceramic tableware and kitchenware from China.

items.title: Independent report: UK-India FTA: report under Section 42 of Agriculture Act 2020
items.summary: Report pursuant to Section 42 of the Agriculture Act 2020 with respect to the UK-India Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement.

items.title: Accredited official statistics: Weekly road fuel prices
items.summary: Road fuel price statistics providing average UK retail 'pump' prices on a weekly basis.

items.title: Research: Net Zero Innovation Portfolio and the Advanced Nuclear Fund: final report, 2021 to 2025
items.summary: This report sets out the progress and impact achieved by the Net Zero Innovation Portfolio (NZIP) and Advanced Nuclear Fund (ANF), over the course of 2021 to 2025.

items.title: Oil and gas: offshore environmental legislation
items.summary: Environmental regulations and guidance on offshore oil and gas exploration and production offshore gas unloading and storage and offshore carbon dioxide storage activities

items.title: Oil and gas: environmental submissions and determinations
items.summary: Interested parties can review records of applications and statements submitted to OPRED as required by environmental regulations.

items.title: British Industrial Competitiveness Scheme: consultation on scheme eligibility and approach
items.summary: We are seeking views on the proposed approach to the new British Industrial Competitiveness Scheme (BICS) and how eligible businesses should be selected.

items.title: Notice: Trade remedies notices: anti-dumping duty on imports of biodiesel originating from China
items.summary: Trade remedies notices published by the Secretary of State for Business and Trade relating to the anti-dumping duty on imports of biodiesel originating from China.

items.title: Transparency data: DBT: workforce management information September 2025
items.summary: Reports on departmental staff numbers and costs.

items.title: Transparency data: DBT: workforce management information October 2025
items.summary: Reports on departmental staff numbers and costs.

items.title: Independent report: Nuclear Regulatory Review 2025
items.summary: The Nuclear Regulatory Taskforce has examined all aspects of the regulation of civil and defence nuclear and produced this review.

items.title: Government acts on top business concern and cuts electricity bills for thousands of manufacturers by up to 25%
items.summary: The Government launches a consultation on the British Industrial Competitiveness Scheme to cut electricity bills for 7,000 manufacturers and boost finance access with a £4 billion British Business Bank plan.

items.title: Taskforce calls for radical reset of nuclear regulation in UK
items.summary: Nuclear Regulatory Taskforce publishes final report and calls for radical reset of overly complex nuclear regulatory system.

items.title: From smartphones to fridges: UK to end overreliance on imports of critical minerals
items.summary: The Government has launched the UK’s new Critical Minerals Strategy.

items.title: Policy paper: UK Critical Minerals Strategy
items.summary: The government's new strategy sets the UK’s long-term ambition to ensure we have the critical minerals we need to drive economic growth and the clean energy transition.

items.title: Research: Research into data standards for Smart Data
items.summary: Research evaluating how existing data standards can support future Smart Data schemes.

items.title: Thousands of British jobs secured as billions of pounds worth of aero deals announced at Dubai Airshow
items.summary: Engineers and manufacturing workers across the UK will benefit from a flurry of major new aircraft deals announced this week at the Dubai Airshow.

items.title: Employ someone: step by step
items.summary: Employ someone: agree a contract, right to work checks, DBS checks, workplace pensions, set up PAYE, tell HMRC

items.title: Research: Help to Grow: Management – evaluation reports
items.summary: A series of reports presenting findings from the independent evaluation of Help to Grow: Management.

items.title: Decision: Jackdaw Field Development
items.summary: Project Summary

items.title: Decision: Dogger Bank Creyke Beck: Non-Material Change, Planning Act 2008
items.summary: Decision by the Secretary of State on an application for a non-material change to an offshore wind farm project.

items.title: Research: Carbon capture, usage and storage (CCUS): business models
items.summary: Updates on the proposed commercial frameworks for transport and storage, power, and industrial carbon capture business models.

items.title: Policy paper: CPTPP: joint ministerial statement in Melbourne, 21 November 2025
items.summary: A jointly prepared statement following the meeting in Melbourne, Australia, on 21 November 2025 of Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP) members.
